text: Zoran "Zoki" Vanev (Serbian/Macedonian: Зоран Ванев) is a Macedonian pop-folk singer. He was born in Štip, Macedonia, Yugoslavia and began his career in 1993 with the release of his song "Angela". He enjoyed moderate success in the Macedonian music industry in the 1990s, however his popularity in Macedonia declined by the turn of the century. In 2003, he released his first Serbian album and is enjoying a successful career in Serbia and in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Many of his songs are about the city of Belgrade but some also mention cities in Bosnia most notably in his song Banja Luka, Beograd. Some of his hits in Serbian include "Lila", "Monika" and "Južna pruga". ==Discography== *Lila (2003) *Momak i Po (2004) *Tanga (2005) *Banjaluka, Beograd (2007) *Unnamed record (2009) ==External links== *Zoran Vanev Homepage in Serbian Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Macedonian male singers Category:Grand Production artists Category:People from Štip Category:Serbian turbo-folk singers Category:Macedonian folk singers Category:Macedonian pop-folk singers
title: Zoran Vanev
